diff_hunk:
@@ -422,6 +426,16 @@
 - name: normal(Tensor self, double mean, double std, Generator generator)
   self: zeros_like(grad)
 
+- name: normal(Tensor mean, double std, Generator generator)
+  mean: grad.type().zeros(mean.sizes())
+
+- name: normal(double mean, Tensor std, Generator generator)
+  std: grad.type().zeros(std.sizes())
+
+- name: normal(Tensor mean, Tensor std, Generator generator)
+  mean: grad.type().zeros(mean.sizes())
+  std: grad.type().zeros(std.sizes())
body: Btw, I like the idea re-parameterizing things like normal() (i.e. the VAE trick).  It seems like a better default than zero or raising exceptions
body_html: Btw, I like the idea re-parameterizing things like normal() (i.e. the VAE trick). It seems like a better default than zero or raising exceptions
body_text: Btw, I like the idea re-parameterizing things like normal() (i.e. the VAE trick).  It seems like a better default than zero or raising exceptions
